physicalContactObject: pair of black scissors with yellow handles
physicalSubstrateObject: telescoping selfie stick with black handle and phone mount
contactUtilizationMethod: Close the blades, then grip one closed blade between thumb and index finger, allowing the handle loops to point outward as you perform fork-like motions

expectedHapticFeedback: Use Fork to fork the cut pieces of steak. When piercing the steak, users should feel a noticeable penetration distance with progressive resistance.
harmony_explanation: The thick foam handle gives several centimetres of penetrable depth and progressive compression, so haptic contact is felt exactly when the visual tines enter the steak. User can reliably strike the large foam area, sustaining good timing.
expressivity_explanation: The dense foam grip allows several millimetres of compressive penetration with gradually increasing resistance and a clear end-stop, mimicking the feeling of piercing soft meat. The scissor tip is narrow enough to concentrate force, so depth and force variations translate into different resistance cues. Lacks multi-tine feedback and foam is more elastic than steak, so expressivity is good but not excellent.
realism_explanation: Foam handle allows several millimetres of penetration with gentle, uniform resistance, but lacks the dense, fibrous give-and-tear sensation of meat. Depth and softness are adequate yet still feel airy and elastic rather than juicy.
